body: Your PR, looks good, but I have a few things that I think should be fixed while we are here: add missing marks.

@Pondorasti The safe area is not used in the cover screen

![img_f82edce11363-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1758210/50058122-dbd50080-0128-11e9-9102-8586e3e4282b.jpeg)
I suspect that this issue root is from our realtime database rules
Hey! Indeed the reason is the rules prevent any missing values for a new user. For now the rules can be removed since they haven't been reviewed
okay cool, can I go ahead and remove them?

@Pondorasti what I have left is for the whole thing to be tested. I haven't been able to present the ReviewVc due to being frustrated d:

Please do a test run by creating a donation and completing the donation with another user. You'll have to clear the database since i've updated from `dev` and the user objects are invalid

I have been testing the app a quite a bit to see if everything works, from a frontend perspective it looks just fine to me. One thing regarding the UX that we are missing in ReviewCollaboratorViewController is the way we handle the error if the user hasn't selected a review, we just ignore the touch received by the button, this could be further improved by using the same error label alongside the animation that we use in RegisterFormViewController or simply show an alert controller, here's a card regarding that https://trello.com/c/VTclybCW
Sound great! Does the button support a disabled state? Thus we only enable it when there's a valid railting
Yup, the custom button is subclassing UIButton and has support for disabling the animation when the user interaction is not enabled.
Maybe do that instead of prompting a message
